title: Atypical angioma serpiginosum.
label: Fig. 1
caption: (A) Grouped, punctate, erythematous macules on the left sole. (B) Similar lesions on toes. (C) Close-up view of the lesions on left sole.

title: Atypical angioma serpiginosum.
label: Fig. 2
caption: (A) Hyperkeratosis and many dilated and proliferated capillaries in the papillary dermis (hematoxylin and eosin, original magnification × 100). (B) Dilated and proliferated congested capillaries at higher power (hematoxylin and eosin, original magnification × 200).

title: Late onset angioma serpiginosum of the breast with co-existing cherry angioma.
label: Figure 1
caption: Multiple, punctate macules in a serpiginious pattern against a bluish background on the right breast with a red smooth papule at the inferior aspect

title: Late onset angioma serpiginosum of the breast with co-existing cherry angioma.
label: Figure 2
caption: Epiluminescence microscopy (×20) revealing the well demarcated red lagoon appearance

title: Late onset angioma serpiginosum of the breast with co-existing cherry angioma.
label: Figure 3
caption: Dilated thin walled capillaries (arrow) in the superficial papillary dermis with an unremarkable deep papillary and reticular dermis. There is no extravasation of erythrocytes, inflammatory cell infiltrate or deposition of hemosiderin in the surrounding tissue (H and E, ×200)

title: Late onset angioma serpiginosum of the breast with co-existing cherry angioma.
label: Figure 4
caption: Cuff of periodic acid-Schiff (PAS) positive diastase-resistant material (arrow) surrounding the dilated vessels (PAS, ×200)

title: Late onset angioma serpiginosum of the breast with co-existing cherry angioma.
label: Figure 5
caption: Well delineated papillary dermal lesion composed of closely placed ectatic thin walled capillaries engorged with erythrocytes (H and E, ×100)

title: Angioma serpiginosum: report of an unusual acral case and review of the literature.
label: FIGURE 1
caption:
A. Clinical features. Deep-red macules, with purple-coloured
punctuate macules on the right sole. B. Clinical features. Deep-red
punctuate macules with a serpiginosum pattern are observed on the dorsum of the
right great toe

title: Angioma serpiginosum: report of an unusual acral case and review of the literature.
label: FIGURE 2
caption:
Dermoscopy shows an erythematous parallel ridge pattern with an irregular globular
component. The red bands are compose of reddish rows of dots and globules arranged
in a double line, and the openings of the acrosiringia are not affected

title: Angioma serpiginosum: report of an unusual acral case and review of the literature.
label: FIGURE 3
caption:
A. Multiple areas of glomerulated proliferation of dilated capillaries in the
superfi cial dermis of the acral skin (H&E x 100). Inset: glomerulated
proliferation of dilated capillaries. B. Negativity of the
immunohistochemical stains for estrogens and progesterone receptors (magnifi
cation × 400)

title: Late-onset Segmental Angioma Serpiginosum.
label: Figure 1
caption: Erythematous macules and papules, in a band-like distribution along T2 dermatome. Besides, discrete lesions can be noted

title: Late-onset Segmental Angioma Serpiginosum.
label: Figure 2
caption: Photomicrograph showing dilated capillaries with a thickened wall (H and E, ×40)

title: Angioma Serpiginosum in a Patchy and Blaschkoid Distribution: A Rare Condition with an Unconventional Presentation.
label: Figure 1
caption: Multiple nonblanchable grouped, pinpoint, red macules on an erythematous base. Note the blaschkoid distribution

title: Angioma Serpiginosum in a Patchy and Blaschkoid Distribution: A Rare Condition with an Unconventional Presentation.
label: Figure 2
caption: Photomicrograph showing dilated, thin-walled capillaries in the dermal papillae and the superficial reticular dermis (H and E, ×400)

title: Angioma Serpiginosum in a Patchy and Blaschkoid Distribution: A Rare Condition with an Unconventional Presentation.
label: Figure 3
caption: Photomicrograph showing dilated, thin-walled capillaries in the dermal papillae and the superficial reticular dermis (H and E, ×100)

title: Blaschkoid Angioma Serpiginosum: A Dermoscopic Diagnosis.
label: Figure 1
caption: Presence of bright red, nonblanchable macules and irregular patches in a blaschkoid pattern over the right upper limb and right side of the chest

title: Blaschkoid Angioma Serpiginosum: A Dermoscopic Diagnosis.
label: Figure 2
caption: Dermoscopy revealed multiple red oval to round lagoons (3Gen Dermlite DL4 Polarized Dermoscope)

title: Blaschkoid Angioma Serpiginosum: A Dermoscopic Diagnosis.
label: Figure 3
caption: (H and E, ×40) Histopathology revealed presence of multiple dilated capillaries with normal endothelial lining in papillary and superficial reticular dermis

title: Angioma serpiginosum: a case report and review of the literature.
label: Fig. 1
caption: Asymptomatic purple maculopapular lesions, with a symmetrical serpiginous linear pattern along both the lower limbs (a,b,c) and soles (d)

title: Angioma serpiginosum: a case report and review of the literature.
label: Fig. 2
caption: Dermoscopy shows parallel structures, red lagoons and globular elements (10x magnification) (a); light microscopy revealed clusters of dilated, thickened capillaries in the upper dermis composed of flattened endothelial cells (b); Periodic acid-Schiff (PAS) stain-positive deposits around the affected blood vessels (c); immunohistochemistry staining showed positive WT1 (d)

title: Clinicopathological and Dermoscopic Features in Blashkoid Angioma Serpiginosum.
label: Figure 1
caption: Multiple pinpoint, grouped, bright red, nonblanchable macules and irregular patches distributed in a patchy blaschkoid pattern over the left side of abdomen.

title: Clinicopathological and Dermoscopic Features in Blashkoid Angioma Serpiginosum.
label: Figure 2
caption: Dermoscopy of the erythematous lesions using a Derm-Lite II Hybrid M Dermatoscope, polarized mode, ×10 magnification, revealed multiple oval-to-round, well-demarcated, red-colored lagoons present on a slightly erythematous background.

title: Clinicopathological and Dermoscopic Features in Blashkoid Angioma Serpiginosum.
label: Figure 3
caption: (A) Photomicrograph showing multiple dilated vessels present in a clover-leaf pattern in the upper dermis (H&E, ×10). (B) Photomicrograph showing cluster of dilated thick-walled capillaries (due to deposition of PAS-positive material) with flattened endothelial cells and red blood cells present in the center of the vessels (H&E, ×40).

title: Angioma serpiginosum in zosteriform distribution on abdomen: A rare presentation.
label: FIGURE 1
caption: Multiple scattered and confluent punctate erythematous to violaceous macules over the left side of the abdomen in T8‐T10 dermatomal distribution

title: Angioma serpiginosum in zosteriform distribution on abdomen: A rare presentation.
label: FIGURE 2
caption: A, Section shows epidermis and dermis with papillomatosis and focal elongation of rete ridges. Hematoxylin and eosin stain (original magnification 10X). B, Basket weaves hyperkeratosis, papillomatosis, hypogranulosis and pigmented basal layer. Papillary dermis showed few ectatic congested thin walled blood vessels. Few areas showed downward growth of the rete ridges between these blood vessels. Hematoxylin and eosin stain (original magnification 40X

title: Angioma serpiginosum: Two cases in children and review of literature.
label: Figure 1.
caption: a) A 13 years old female with history of asymptomatic red lesion on her left shoulder blade for 2 years. b) Dermoscopy revealed well demarcated round red lagoons in relation to dilated vascular spaces within the papillary or superficial reticular dermis, hairpin like vessels scattered among red lagoons (aspect of “school of red fish in a pound”).

title: Angioma serpiginosum: Two cases in children and review of literature.
label: Figure 2.
caption: a) A 8 years old male had erythematous reticulated macules affecting right arm since birth. b) Small purple-red dots that cluster together and they do not disappear on diascopy.

title: Angioma serpiginosum: Two cases in children and review of literature.
label: Figure 3.
caption: EE - Clusters of dilated capillaries in the upper dermis, composed of flattened endothelial cells and pericytes.

title: Atypical Distribution of Angioma Serpiginosum: A Report of 2 Cases.
label: Figure 1
caption: Generalized, numerous, pinpoint, reddish macules over malar area in first patient

title: Atypical Distribution of Angioma Serpiginosum: A Report of 2 Cases.
label: Figure 2
caption: Generalized, numerous, pinpoint, reddish macules over bilateral breasts, bilateral arms, and chest in first patient

title: Atypical Distribution of Angioma Serpiginosum: A Report of 2 Cases.
label: Figure 3
caption: Multiple, grouped, pinpoint, reddish-to-pinkish macules over right arm, right breast and, back in and blaschkoid pattern in second patient

title: Atypical Distribution of Angioma Serpiginosum: A Report of 2 Cases.
label: Figure 4
caption: (Hematoxylin & Eosin, ×40) Histopathology of the first patient revealed presence of substantial increase in number of dilated capillaries within papillary and upper reticular dermis. Overlying epidermis is normal

title: Atypical Distribution of Angioma Serpiginosum: A Report of 2 Cases.
label: Figure 5
caption: Dermoscopy revealed multiple red, oval-to-round lagoons (3Gen Dermlite DL4 Polarized Dermatoscope)

title: Angioma Serpiginosum with Soft Tissue Hypertrophy and Palmar Involvement: A Rare Presentation.
label: Figure 1
caption: (a) Multiple discrete to con fluent brightly erythematous papules on right scapular area, posterior aspect of right arm arranged in linear serpiginous pattern. (b) similar lesions present on lateral half of velar aspect of forearm,lateral aspect of dorsum of hand arranged in serpiginous pattern

title: Angioma Serpiginosum with Soft Tissue Hypertrophy and Palmar Involvement: A Rare Presentation.
label: Figure 2
caption: Close up view

title: Angioma Serpiginosum with Soft Tissue Hypertrophy and Palmar Involvement: A Rare Presentation.
label: Figure 3
caption: Multiple erythematous papules arranged in the form of small rings with central clearing on right scapular area

title: Angioma Serpiginosum with Soft Tissue Hypertrophy and Palmar Involvement: A Rare Presentation.
label: Figure 4
caption: Erythematous patch present on lateral aspect of palms involving the air eminence, right thumb and index finger

title: Angioma Serpiginosum with Soft Tissue Hypertrophy and Palmar Involvement: A Rare Presentation.
label: Figure 5
caption: Erythematous patch present on dorsum of right hand with diffuse non tender swelling of right hand in comparison to left

title: Angioma Serpiginosum with Soft Tissue Hypertrophy and Palmar Involvement: A Rare Presentation.
label: Figure 6
caption: Histopathology (H & E, 40× view). Mutiple ectatic vascular structures present in papillary dermis and mid -dermis

title: Angioma Serpiginosum with Soft Tissue Hypertrophy and Palmar Involvement: A Rare Presentation.
label: Figure 7
caption: Histopathology (H & E stain, 100×): multiple ectatic vascular structures were present in papillary and mid dermis
